--- id: 381 title: 'What is Linked Data?' date: '2018-09-23T14:11:12+10:00' author: ubiquitous layout: post guid: 'https://www.webizen.net.au/?p=381' permalink: /what-is-linked-data/ inline_featured_image: - '0' categories: - 'Video Library' - 'What is RDF?' ---
What is Linked Data?
A short non-technical introduction to Linked Data, Google's Knowledge Graph, and Facebook's Open Graph Protocol. If you have any questions, hit me up on Twitter: @manusporny or G+: Manu Sporny
[Prev](#)1 of 1[Next](#)
- [
![What is Linked Data?](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/4x_xzT5eF5Q/hqdefault.jpg)
### What is Linked Data?
A short non-technical introduction to Linked Data, Google's Knowledge Graph, and Facebook's Open Graph Protocol. If you have any questions, hit me up on Twitter: @manusporny or G+: Manu Sporny
](#4x_xzT5eF5Q "What is Linked Data?") - [
![Jargon Free Linked Data](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/gd6ccBomspw/sddefault.jpg)
### Jargon Free Linked Data
My talk with Bernadette Hyland from the 2013 Health Datapalooza in Washington, DC, compressed into a quick 21 minutes.
](#gd6ccBomspw "Jargon Free Linked Data") - [
![RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VFYLu83WtX0/sddefault.jpg)
### RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4
The Resource Description Framework (RDF) as explained by Dr. Suess and me.
](#VFYLu83WtX0 "RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4") - [
![RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VFYLu83WtX0/sddefault.jpg)
### RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4
The Resource Description Framework (RDF) as explained by Dr. Suess and me.
](#VFYLu83WtX0 "RDF Explained by Suess and me.mp4") - [
![Linked Data for Libraries, Archives and Museums](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/MnM3tHWAsSA/sddefault.jpg)
### Linked Data for Libraries, Archives and Museums
New handbook: How to clean, link and publish your metadata Discover the book at http://book.freeyourmetadata.org/ Order on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Linked-Data-Libraries-Archives-Museums/dp/1856049647/
](#MnM3tHWAsSA "Linked Data for Libraries, Archives and Museums") - [
![Why I LOVE 💖 Linked Data- And Maybe You Should Too](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0LZHXBxG87k/sddefault.jpg)
### Why I LOVE 💖 Linked Data- And Maybe You Should Too
Linked Data has a lot of benefits, mapping between entities, sharing of data across dispersed databases, and making ETL way easier if you are using the base standards from W3C. Come check out some of the other things I love about Linked Data, and why you might want to go and check it out for yourself. Stay in touch: LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ashleighnfaith/ Direct Message: isadatathing-at-gmail.com Videos on linked data: https://youtu.be/l6amUpDMJ4s https://youtu.be/YCEeoyZkl-U https://youtu.be/l1q7JGRrTNs https://youtu.be/yg1Kboe-Y3E https://youtu.be/4x_xzT5eF5Q More Resources: https://www.w3.org/standards/semanticweb/data https://www.ontotext.com/knowledgehub/fundamentals/linked-data-linked-open-data/ https://medium.com/virtuoso-blog/linked-data-ontologies-and-knowledge-graphs-a3d0ad6d6f66 https://www.researchgate.net/publication/312485719_Enterprise_Knowledge_Graphs_A_Backbone_of_Linked_Enterprise_Data https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/978-3-319-45654-6 https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Main_Page https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/index.html https://lod-cloud.net/
](#0LZHXBxG87k "Why I LOVE 💖 Linked Data- And Maybe You Should Too") - [
![Linked Open Data, what on earth is that?](https://i.ytimg.com/vi/mMR6JQ1M6qE/sddefault.jpg)
### Linked Open Data, what on earth is that?
Linked Open Data? Tell me more, what's that? Learn from Winifred Lamb, the Fitzwilliam's Honorary Curator of Antiquities! An AHRC funded animation for the Linking Islands of Data Project, led by Professor Daniel Pett and Professor Elton Barker (Open University) with the Pelagios Community, Getty Museum, Institute for the Study of the Ancient World, American Numismatics Society, Brown University, School of Advanced Study University of London. The animation was made by Ed Tracy of Too Tall Productions and the voice over by Dr Hannah Platts of Royal Holloway University of London. Photogrammetry 3D models created by Daniel Pett, rendering of Fitzwilliam gallery by Ed Tracy, Digital Periegesis mapping Pausanias application from University of Uppsala and Rainer Simon, numismatics from American Numismatics Society/Nomisma. All 3D models can be found on Sketchfab - https://sketchfab.com/fitzwilliammuseum/collections/gallery-21 and can be downloaded under CC-BY-NC license. Part 2 on how to make data is here https://youtu.be/0m79yDb4AzE
](#mMR6JQ1M6qE "Linked Open Data, what on earth is that?")
